creator: humit media, inc.
descriptionHtml:
humit is a social networking app for music sharing and discovery. The app lets you share 30s audio snippets of powerful moments from your favorite songs AKA “hums”. These hums can then be conveniently sampled by your followers in an endless feed of fresh new music.

Let’s face it, music sharing on mobile is broken — sharing a URL through Facebook/ Messenger/ Instagram Stories/ WhatsApp means jumping between apps, and there's often no feedback on whether someone liked the song or not. On the other hand, algorithmic recommendations go no further than saying “here’s another song that sounds extremely similar to the one you just listened to”.

humit is here to fix all of that...

Some of the latest features include 🤘
1. Reel mode 🎉: with options to like, bookmark, extend hum, toggle auto-play, reply and recommend
2. Media 👾: apart from album art/ photos, you can now add GIFs to all your hums
3. Real-time messaging 💬: now you can reply to hums and chat about anything music with your friends on humit
4. Recommend hums 💪: share your favorite hums with your followers 1:1
5. Stations 📻: moderated communities around genres, moods and themes. From #Party_Music, #TheBeatlesFC to #Space_Rap, you can find crowdsourced recommendations on virtually any kind of music. The sky’s not the limit here
6. Profile 🙋🏻‍♂️: flaunt your taste in music based on your Spotify listening history, top artists and hums
7. Referral 👫: you can now start inviting your friends over to check out humit with an invite code unique to you


With so many music libraries and messaging options available, sharing music is far more complicated than it should be. While music libraries are great to listen to, they lack compelling social features. Social networks are good for sharing, but provide a mediocre listening experience. Humit provides a music-specific platform to seamlessly discover and listen to music from friends in one place, agnostic of your steaming platform of choice.

P.S. The release is currently limited to Spotify users. Apple Music and SoundCloud integrations are in the works.
descriptionShort: humit is a cool way for friends to share and discover music together

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
Spotify Premium users are in for a treat.
Enjoy the new lock screen player controls, for when you're not ready to press that extra button.
All your followed stations appear as a scrollable list at the top of your feed because we know how you hate pressing that extra button.
We've fixed a host of other bugs that we don't want to point out because frankly it's just embarrassing that we left them unattended for this long.

You now have 0 excuses to not share hums. Go on.. share hums.

We just got a facelift!
Apart from a slicker UI, here's what you can look forward to:
- a far smoother experience for free Spotify users
- better ways to be notified when hums in your station are flagged
- convenient ways to moderate your station
- a way to edit your top artists
- a smooth tik-tok-eque scroll experience to sample through hums
hope you dig!

5. Stations 📻: moderated communities around genres, moods, and themes. From #Party_Music, #TheBeatlesFC to #Space_Rap, you can find crowdsourced recommendations on virtually any kind of music. The sky’s not the limit here
6. Profile 🙋🏻‍♂️: flaunt your taste in music based on your Spotify listening history, top artists and hums
7. Referral 👫: you can now start inviting your friends over to check out humit with an invite code unique to you

With so many music libraries and messaging options available, sharing music is far more complicated than it should be. While music libraries are great to listen to, they lack compelling social features. Social networks are good for sharing but provide a mediocre listening experience. Humit provides a music-specific platform to seamlessly discover and listen to music from friends in one place, agnostic of your streaming platform of choice.

P.S. The release is currently limited to Spotify users. Apple Music and SoundCloud integrations are in the works.
descriptionShort: humit is a cool way for friends to share and discover music together

title: humit - social music sharing and discovery

creator: humit media, inc.
descriptionHtml:
humit is a social networking app for music sharing and discovery. The app lets you share 30s audio snippets of powerful moments from your favorite songs AKA “hums”. These hums can then be conveniently sampled by your followers in an endless feed of fresh new music.

Let’s face it, music sharing on mobile is broken — sharing a URL through Facebook/ Messenger/ Instagram Stories/ WhatsApp means jumping between apps, and there's often no feedback on whether someone liked the song or not. On the other hand, algorithmic recommendations go no further than saying “here’s another song that sounds extremely similar to the one you just listened to”.

humit is here to fix all of that...

2. Media 👾: apart from album art/ photos, you can now add GIFs to all your hums
3. Real-time messaging 💬: now you can reply to hums and chat about anything music with your friends on humit
4. Recommend hums 💪: share your favorite hums with your followers 1:1
5. Stations 📻: moderated communities around genres, moods, and themes. From #Party_Music, #TheBeatlesFC to #Space_Rap, you can find crowdsourced recommendations on virtually any kind of music. The sky’s not the limit here
6. Profile 🙋🏻‍♂️: flaunt your taste in music based on your Spotify listening history, top artists and hums
7. Referral 👫: you can now start inviting your friends over to check out humit with an invite code unique to you

With so many music libraries and messaging options available, sharing music is far more complicated than it should be. While music libraries are great to listen to, they lack compelling social features. Social networks are good for sharing but provide a mediocre listening experience. Humit provides a music-specific platform to seamlessly discover and listen to music from friends in one place, agnostic of your streaming platform of choice.

P.S. The release is currently limited to Spotify users. Apple Music and SoundCloud integrations are in the works.

title: humit - social music sharing and discovery

creator: humit media, inc.
descriptionHtml:
humit is a social networking app for music sharing and discovery. The app lets you share 30s audio snippets of powerful moments from your favorite songs AKA “hums”. These hums can then be conveniently sampled by your followers in an endless feed of fresh new music.

Let’s face it, music sharing on mobile is broken — sharing a URL through Facebook/ Messenger/ Instagram Stories/ WhatsApp means jumping between apps, and there's often no feedback on whether someone liked the song or not. On the other hand, algorithmic recommendations go no further than saying “here’s another song that sounds extremely similar to the one you just listened to”.

humit is here to fix all of that...

Some of the latest features include 🤘
1. Reel mode 🎉: with options to like, bookmark, extend hum, toggle auto-play, reply and recommend
2. Media 👾: apart from album art/ photos, you can now add GIFs to all your hums
3. Real-time messaging 💬: now you can reply to hums and chat about anything music with your friends on humit
4. Recommend hums 💪: share your favorite hums with your followers 1:1
5. Stations 📻: moderated communities around genres, moods, and themes. From #Party_Music, #TheBeatlesFC to #Space_Rap, you can find crowdsourced recommendations on virtually any kind of music. The sky’s not the limit here
6. Profile 🙋🏻‍♂️: flaunt your taste in music based on your Spotify listening history, top artists and hums
7. Referral 👫: you can now start inviting your friends over to check out humit with an invite code unique to you

While music libraries are great to listen to, they lack compelling social features. Social networks are good for sharing but provide a mediocre listening experience. Humit provides a music-specific platform to seamlessly discover and listen to music from friends in one place, agnostic of your streaming platform of choice.

P.S. The release is currently limited to Spotify users. Apple Music and SoundCloud integrations are in the works.

title: humit - social music sharing and discovery

creator: humit media, inc.
descriptionHtml:
humit is a social networking app made for music fans like you. Over here you can discover millions of songs, share your favourite parts from hit tracks via 30-second hums and make new friends with the same music vibe as you. And all of it for free!

Music feels better when you talk about it. Whether it be being vocal about your music taste, flexing it amongst friends, engaging with a community of audio stans or having conversations around the culture. And that’s why, humit is here to make music social again.

🎵 Music for all. All for music: humit syncs seamlessly with your Spotify account, so you can discover and share music from its 70 million+ catalogue with ease and with no added cost.

🌎 Join a global community: 25,000 music geeks from 100+ countries are already on humit. Walk into this bloc party without borders.

😎 Chill with your crew: Keep your clan close with real-time messaging. Share music, memes and memories.

📻 All you need is Radio Gaga: Browse through 1200+ stations or moderated communities covering a wide range of genres, mood and themes. From the Beatles to Billie, party bangers to quarantunes - there’s something for everyone.

🎙 Flaunt your taste: Share your awesome taste in music and get rewarded for it. Bag cool badges, unlock profile customisations and earn some culture cred.

▶️ Press play on new friends: Meet the ones you can share earphones with. Find new people with the same music taste as you every day.

Love music? Hear it. humit.

P.S. The release is currently limited to Spotify users. Apple Music and SoundCloud integrations are in the works.
descriptionShort: discover & share music, make new friends from 100+ countries
